comments.commentBody:
BREAKING NEWS: Going for a walk and eating less still FDA approved.

Sorry to be crass, but when almost a billion people are starving in the world, I'm not too saddened by the plight of the pudgy.
How about pushing a new drug called "Exercise" bundled exclusively with a video entitled "STOP EATING SO MUCH"

The only good pill is the hardest one to swallow. Diet and Exercise.
Just ask Jillian Michaels,.........
Rx: Exercise. Is that one FDA approved?

There is an excellent "diet pill" already on the market. Not only is it free and without side effects it actually puts money in your pocket.
It is called "Eating less". What a concept.

Perhaps sneakers should have a prescription....Diet + exercise seems a more effective way than a drug, which will always have side effects.  I used to be overweight, not sure obese but definitely close.  I am now at a healthy 110 for my 5'2" frame.  Is it easy?  No, some days I drag myself out of bed to exercise and some days I go to bed hungry.  But for the vast majority of people (I don't see any fat people in area of Africa where food is scarce) exercise and diet will work.  Why don't we invest in finding a drug to cure cancer, etc? when we already have the answer to obesity.

>>Regulators seem to have heightened their scrutiny of diet pills that could pose risks to the heart or other organs, diminishing the options available to overweight Americans.<<

Risking your heart's health taking quack pills should never be, and should have never been, a weight-loss option. Americans wouldn't need these unsafe options if we better regulated the Industrial Food Complex and banned all their lobbyists from Washington.

This article is ridiculous.  Diet and exercise are what is needed to maintain weight loss.  The reps for pharmaceutical companies of course feel that they want people on a weight loss drug their entire lives... the next statin.  I love the quote - patients stay on statins because their doctors tell them to.  Heaven forbid patients lose weight with diet and exercise and stay off statins.  Heaven forbid we live in a culture where we don't have to take 5 different medications daily for the rest of our lives.  Oh wait, then where would the pharmaceutical companies be?

If we had an independent testing agency, such as the Underwriters Laboratories - entirely non-profit to test ALL pharmaceuticals, instead of relying upon corporatist lies and propaganda, we wouldn't be in this fix.  Better still - nationalize all pharmaceutical industries but keep the independent testing agency as part of a checks and balances system.

Two things are needed: One at the individual level - individuals need to commit themselves to changing their life to eat healthy, whole, real foods, exercise and to make the time in their life to do those things.

Two: as a nation, we must stop promoting fast foods, cheap calories and our looking for no-pain solutions. Subsidies to corn farmers should stop. Drugs are not the answer to every problem.

In the first line,
"The Food and Drug Administration rejected another new diet pill on Thursday, the latest setback in the quest to develop treatments for overweight Americans amid the nation’s obesity epidemic."
Why is this a "setback"? Couldn't this read something to the effect of, "... the latest success story in the FDA's mission to find balance between protecting people's health and supporting healthy business."? I'm glad the FDA is cautious.

People please, diet pill don't work .
Drink a gallon of water a day , eat only organic natural whole foods .... and stop eating junk food , candy , soda, fast food. geezzzzz , some common sense please .... and stop being brainwashed by the media to eat junk food and then take a toxic chemical pharma pill to fix it .

We embrace this brand-name economy. We buy the brand name processed foods instead of buying staples and eating a sane diet. It is our way. We have become a fat people. We need a brand name pill to make it go away. That us our solution. It is our way. Have some respect for our rich cultural heritage. Thank you.

Why would the government want provide an appetite suppressant which might reduce obesity when obesity is clearly beneficial to high levels of consumption and shorter life expectancy.  The government can reduce the number of folks that would inevitably require health care and retirement benefits while simultaneously ensuring a large, TEMPORARY, work force of maximized consumption!  Everyone wins - except the obese!

If the majority of the medical and scientific community & big Pharma were actually interested in disease prevention they would be honest with the public and tell them to adopt a plant based diet. They would also mention the most comprehensive nutritional study ever undertaken called -- The China Study -- which clearly shows that animal products is at the center of most illnesses including cancer and diabetes. But these profit-driven industries are far more interested in increasing their profits and keeping the public sick. If they teach about prevention through a plant based diet, Vitamin D, exercise, consumer product use & nutritional supplementation, it would be a bad business decision.

Breast cancer is anywhere from 70%-90% preventable through the above simple changes. But then the whole "pinkwashing" scam by many industries wouldn't be able to ask the public to buy their animal products, the very products that actually are the cause of breast cancer and other forms of cancer. The Breast Cancer industry should be ashamed. They talk about breast cancer awareness. What about breast cancer prevention? The father of medicine Hippocrates would be appalled. He said let thy food be they medicine and thy medicine be thy food. The breast cancer industry are exploiting women. The majority of the medical and scientific community are exploiting the general public, in particular, disenfranchised groups.

Animal products are the major cause of obesity, a major cause of breast cancer and other diseases. So we need to stop paying attention to these profit driven industries and symptom focused Big pharma and science, and do our own research..

Adopt a plant based diet and stop consuming animal products altogether. But the most important reason to go VEGAN, is because it's not only easy, but it's better for us, for the planet, and most importantly, it's the morally right thing to do. If you want to find out more about veganism -- http://www.veganpamphlet.com

“It’s tough to be a doctor and try to do something about the biggest problem in the U.S...”

Yeah, because a doctor can't force a patient to stop eating potato chips and ice cream.

It's as simple as that. We will stop spending so much on health care the moment we stop buying (covering) lifestyle/recreational drugs.

comments.userDisplayName: Lyle Vos, Democratic Candidate for President 2012
comments.commentBody:
Oh my. What about a suit against the bicycle manufacturer. Bicycles designed for 5 year olds are inherently dangerous as the manufacturer cannot expect a 5 year old to have the prudence to avoid injury to others. This is like making a handgun designed for and marketed to 5 year olds.

Childhood now ends at 4. Oh my.

The ruling makes sense.............someone is responsible for the woman's death......I expect the mother was with the 4 yr old to supervise her behavior.......therefore the mother was responsible for not providing the proper supervision and allowing the 4 year old to race her bike on the sidewalk where people/person was walking.
Very sad. A woman survives the many dangers and pitfalls of life for 80+ years only to have it snuffed out by a woman too careless to control her child. If the woman was negligent walking her dog and it killed the 80 year old woman there would be no question of her negligence. Why should she not be responsible for her 4 year old child?
What are they planning on suing her for? 4.4 million mnm's? Her barbie collection?
I hate lawyers.  I'm sure those children are little monsters, but that is their parent's fault.  A four-year-old is not a responsible party.  Sue the parents; certainly.  But not the children
OK. Time for torte reform.

Is "stupid" too strong a word? Whether is is or not it is appropriate.
What a stupid decision. And what happens if she is guilty? She gets sued?

Good lord. Do the antics of our officials remind anyone else of pre-war Berlin?
What is behind this? Does the girl have assets her parents do not?
April Fools?  Or the death of reason.  Sheesh.
And if the elderly woman's estate wins the suit, what? They'll garnish her kindergarten lunch money?  Take her trike and stuffed Barney?  Legal greed knows no bounds.
